item.title: Aegean biodiversity
item.description: Why focus on continental archipelagos? Although oceanic islands are less numerous compared to the non-oceanic, they dominate ecological and evolutionary theory, compared to continental island systems, which have received much less attention than oceanic islands and archipelagos (e.g., Whittaker et al., 2017). Thus, continental archipelagos, such as the Aegean, provide exceptional opportunities for the refinement and further development of island theory, especially those parts mainly based on oceanic islands.
